title: 4-year-old in grave condition after shooting
content:
Police have filed no charges in a shooting Friday night in the 3400 block of Algonquin Parkway that left a 4-year-old girl in grave condition.
Dwight Mitchell, a Louisville Metro police spokesman, said police are still investigating but don't think a crime was committed.
He said the results of the investigation will be turned over to the commonwealth's attorney's office.
The girl, whose identity has not be released, was taken to Kosair Children's Hospital where Mitchell said she was in "very, very critical condition."
The shooting took place in the Park DuValle neighborhood, about 7:17 p.m., police said.
Police blocked downtown streets so a parade of patrol cars and an ambulance could rush the child to Kosair.
He said police are investigation whether the girl shot herself and whether the shooting was an accident.
"Whenever a shooting involves a kid, it is very troubling," he said.
The girl was shot inside her own house on Algonquin near Dixie Highway, Mitchell said.
He said police are interviewing adults who were in the home at the time.
Reporter Andrew Wolfson can be reached at (502) 582-7189
